meanings.definition: Having cogs or teeth for engaging with other cogs or gears.
meanings.sent1: The cogged wheel turned smoothly with the other gears.
meanings.sent2: The clock had a cogged mechanism that kept perfect time.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot had cogged arms that moved in sync.
meanings.sent4: The old machine had cogged parts that interlocked perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The bicycle chain had cogged links that meshed perfectly with the gears.
